name: Database Design Document Template
description: Comprehensive database design document template for database architects, DBAs, and developers
author: Document Writer Extension

variables.name: projectTitle
variables.placeholder: e.g., Customer Management System Database

variables.name: author
variables.description: Author of the database design document
variables.placeholder: e.g., John Smith, Database Architect

variables.name: date
variables.placeholder: Current date will be used if not specified

variables.name: company
variables.placeholder: e.g., ACME Corporation

variables.name: databaseName
variables.placeholder: e.g., customer_management_db, crm_database

variables.name: databasePurpose
variables.description: Primary purpose and scope of the database
variables.placeholder: Detailed description of what the database is intended to accomplish

variables.name: technologies
variables.placeholder: e.g., PostgreSQL 14, MySQL 8.0, SQL Server 2019, MongoDB 5.0

variables.name: functionalRequirements
variables.placeholder: List of functional requirements the database must support

variables.name: nonFunctionalRequirements
variables.placeholder: Performance, scalability, security, availability requirements

variables.name: performanceRequirements
variables.placeholder: Response times, throughput, concurrent users, data volume requirements

variables.name: erdOverview
variables.description: Overview of the Entity Relationship Diagram
variables.placeholder: High-level description of the main entities and their relationships

variables.name: mainEntities
variables.description: List and description of main entities
variables.placeholder: Detailed list of primary entities with brief descriptions

variables.name: tableSchemas
variables.description: Detailed table schemas with columns and data types
variables.placeholder: Complete table definitions with column names, data types, constraints

variables.name: primaryKeys
variables.description: Primary key definitions for all tables
variables.placeholder: List of primary keys for each table with justification

variables.name: foreignKeys
variables.placeholder: Detailed foreign key constraints and referential integrity rules

variables.name: constraints
variables.placeholder: Check constraints, unique constraints, and business rule enforcement

variables.name: indexes
variables.placeholder: Clustered and non-clustered indexes, performance optimization indexes

variables.name: storageRequirements
variables.placeholder: Storage size estimates, file groups, partitioning strategy

variables.name: partitioning
variables.placeholder: Horizontal/vertical partitioning, partition keys, partition management

variables.name: performanceConsiderations
variables.placeholder: Query optimization, caching strategies, hardware considerations

variables.name: erdDiagram
variables.placeholder: Description or reference to ERD diagram file

variables.name: relationshipDiagrams
variables.placeholder: References to additional schema diagrams and their purposes

variables.name: dataDictionary
variables.placeholder: Detailed field descriptions, data types, constraints, and business meanings

variables.name: storedProcedures
variables.placeholder: List of stored procedures, functions, triggers with descriptions and purposes

variables.name: triggers
variables.placeholder: Trigger definitions, events, and business logic implementation

variables.name: userRoles
variables.placeholder: User roles, access levels, and permission matrices

variables.name: accessControl
variables.placeholder: Authentication methods, authorization rules, security policies

variables.name: encryptionStrategy
variables.placeholder: Encryption at rest, in transit, key management, sensitive data protection

variables.name: backupStrategy
variables.placeholder: Backup types, frequency, retention policies, backup verification

variables.name: recoveryProcedures
variables.placeholder: Recovery point objectives, recovery time objectives, recovery procedures

variables.name: businessContinuity
variables.placeholder: High availability solutions, failover procedures, business continuity measures

variables.name: indexOptimization
variables.placeholder: Index maintenance, statistics updates, query plan optimization

variables.name: queryOptimization
variables.placeholder: Query tuning strategies, execution plan analysis, performance monitoring

variables.name: maintenancePlan
variables.placeholder: Regular maintenance tasks, monitoring procedures, performance tuning schedule

variables.name: migrationPlan
variables.placeholder: Migration approach, data validation, rollback procedures

variables.name: deploymentProcedure
variables.placeholder: Step-by-step deployment process, validation steps, post-deployment verification

variables.name: testingStrategy
variables.placeholder: Unit testing, integration testing, performance testing, data validation

sections.name: Title Page
sections.description: Cover page with database project title, company, author, and version

sections.name: Database Overview
sections.description: High-level overview of database name, version, purpose, and technologies

sections.name: Conceptual Design
sections.description: ERD overview and main entities description

sections.name: Logical Design
sections.description: Detailed table schemas, keys, constraints, and indexes

sections.name: Physical Design
sections.description: Storage requirements, partitioning, and performance considerations

sections.name: Data Dictionary
sections.description: Comprehensive field descriptions and data definitions

sections.name: Security and Access Control
sections.description: User roles, permissions, and security measures

sections.name: Backup and Recovery Strategy
sections.description: Backup procedures and disaster recovery planning

styling.table: bordered with header highlighting and technical formatting
styling.spacing: technical document with consistent margins and section breaks

usageInstructions: Fill in all required database design variables before generating the document
Table schemas should include complete column definitions with data types
Include detailed ERD descriptions and relationship mappings
Specify comprehensive security and access control requirements
Document all performance requirements with specific metrics
The template is designed for professional database architecture documentation
All sections follow database design documentation best practices
Include specific technology versions and configuration details
